msDesc.head: Catena to the New Testament (Acts, Epistles of Paul, Catholic Epistles)

msItem.note: Blank endleaves, except for title information and a note of acquisition on .

support.p:
Western paper
Quarto
TUMBA; crown
N:o 2
. The second watermark is the countermark to the previous one.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation in pencil by a modern hand in the lower right margin: 1–220. Pagination in ink in the upper right margin of recto pages: 1–439.

handDesc.handNote:
Pehr Fabian Aurivillius
Pagination and brief marginal notes in a modern hand, for example in the upper margin on .

Stig Yngve Rudberg
Foliation in pencil in a modern hand.

bindingDesc.p:
Lace-attached case binding sewn on three supports. Half covered with parchment and marbled paper over paper boards. Endbands in blue and white. Paper strips from a Greek liturgical print have been used for restauration work at the spine; traces of text are visible on
.

Two types of paper are present as endleaves. One leaf , , is probably from the late seventeenth century and might be Italian to judge from the purchase note mentioning Venice. On the other endleaves there are watermarks from a Swedish paper mill, Tumba Bruk.
The binding was accomplished in the mid-eighteenth century, presumably on the commission of Uppsala University Library.

history.origin: Probably written in the second half of the thirteenth century. Place unknown.
history.provenance: At some point the volume came to Venice, where it came on the market in the late seventeenth century.
history.acquisition:
It was acquired there by Johan Gabriel Sparwenfeldt
, who was staying in Venice from November 1692 to February 1693 and again in October–December 1693; cf. note on : Joh. Chrysostomi homiliae in Acta apost. (absque principio) et in 14 Epist. Pauli. Codex de caetero magnae antiquitatis et aestimationis, Emptus Venetiis a J. G. Sparwenfeldt. Donated to Uppsala University Library in .

bibl.title: Catalogus centuriae librorum rarissimorum manuscript. et partim impressorum, arabicorum, persicorum, turcicorum, græcorum, latinorum, etc.
Codex Græcus novi foederis e biblioth. acad. Upsal. descriptus et collatus, etc.
Notices sommaires des manuscrits grecs de Suède
The Greek New Testament Manuscripts in Sweden with an Excursus on the Jerusalem Colophon
Svensk Exegetisk Årsbok

msItem.title: Catena in Acta Apostolorum
msItem.incipit: τοῦτο ἀληθὲς καὶ τὸ τῶν σημείων Πνεῦμα
msItem.finalRubric: τέλος τοῦ κειμένου καὶ τῆς ἑρμηνείας τῶν πράξεων
msItem.note:
The manuscript has lost its first folia and the text starts mid-sentence with the commentary to Acts VIII:9–15. Cf.
Jacques-Paul Migne
http://viaf.org/viaf/64009375
Patrologiae cursus completus. Series graeca PG Paris
. After the catena to Acts but before the final rubric, the Peregrinatio Pauli Apostoli is also included (
Jacques-Paul Migne
http://viaf.org/viaf/64009375
Patrologiae cursus completus. Series graeca PG Paris
). Lastly, there is a stichometric note and a question-and-answer about the number of epistles by Paul.

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam ad Romanos
msItem.note: A list of the Epistles of Paul and the Catholic Epistles follows upon the Argumentum. At the end of the text a stichometric note: ἡ πρὸς Ῥωμαίους ἐπιστολὴ. ἐγράφη ἀπὸ Κορίνθου διὰ Φοίβης τῆς διακόνου τῆς ἐν Κεγχρεαῖς· στίχοι ϡκʹ.

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam primam ad Corinthios
msItem.rubric: Ὑπόθεσις τῆς πρὸς Κορινθίους πρώτης ἐπιστολῆς
msItem.note:
Note that this explicit is situated at the bottom of , not on as one could have expected.; cf.
Jacques-Paul Migne
http://viaf.org/viaf/64009375
Patrologiae cursus completus. Series graeca PG Paris
.

supportDesc.foliation: Traces of an older foliation in ink in the upper right margin: see e.g. (Γʹ), (θʹ). Most of these numbers are lost due to trimming.

collation.formula: Q1If.2 + Q2IIf.6 + Q3Vf.16 + Q4IIIf.22 + Q53f.f.25: no thread visible due to adhesive at the spine + Q6IIf.29 + Q71/2f.32 + Q8IIf.36 + Q92/1f.39 + Q10–145.IVf.79 + Q15IIf.83 + Q16IVf.91

bibl.title: Répertoire de réglures dans les manuscrits grecs sur parchemin: base de données
Sautel

handDesc.handNote: Written with black and blackish-brown ink in a neat and regular upright minuscule interspersed with majuscule forms and some enlarged letters (tau, kappa, gamma). Writing pending from ruled lines. Ample use of abbreviations. Initials and subtitles in a bright cadmium red ink.

decoDesc.p: Very sparingly decorated. Rubricized plain initials, 1–2 lines high, passim; larger and elaborate ones, 3 lines high, only at the beginning of new text items, and these are still rather crude and simple in style. On a headpiece with interlace pattern in red, black, and white (unfilled outline). On a line filler in black and red and a simple interlace knot in the margin. Subtitles are sometimes written in red ink but without any further embellishment.

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam primam ad Corinthios
msItem.note:
The epistle starts mid-text, at 1 Cor. 13:5, as a completion of the preceding codicological unit; cf.
Jacques-Paul Migne
http://viaf.org/viaf/64009375
Patrologiae cursus completus. Series graeca PG Paris
. More or less the same passage of the catena is covered in and in . A stichometric note at the end: ἀναγνώσεις εʹ, κεφάλαια θʹ, μαρτυρίαι ιζʹ· στίχοι ωνʹ.

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam secundam ad Corinthios
msItem.rubric: Ὑπόθεσις τῆς πρὸς Κορινθίους βʹ ἐπιστολῆς
msItem.note: Ends with the stichometric number στίχοι φϟʹ.

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam ad Galatas
msItem.note: Ends with the stichometric number στίχοι σγʹ.

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam ad Ephesienses
msItem.finalRubric: Πρὸς Ἐφεσίους ἐγράφη ἀπὸ Ῥώμης διὰ Τυχικοῦ· στίχοι τιβʹ

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam ad Philippenses
msItem.finalRubric: Πρὸς Φιλιππησίους ἐγράφη ἀπὸ Ῥώμης δι’ Ἐπαφραδίτου· στίχοι σηʹ

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam ad Colossenses
msItem.finalRubric: Πρὸς Κολοσσαεῖς· ἐγράφη ὑπὸ Παύλου καὶ Τιμοθέου· ἀπεστάλη διὰ Τυχικοῦ καὶ Ὀνησίμου

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam primam ad Thessalonicenses
msItem.rubric: Ὑπόθεσις τῆς πρὸς Θεσσαλονικεῖς πρώτης ἐπιστολῆς
msItem.finalRubric: Πρὸς Θεσσαλονικεῖς πρώτη. ἐγράφη ἀπὸ Ἀθηνῶν· στίχοι ρϟγʹ

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam secundam ad Thessalonicenses
msItem.rubric: Ὑπόθεσις τῆς πρὸς Θεσσαλονικεῖς βʹ ἐπιστολῆς
msItem.finalRubric: Πρὸς Θεσσαλονικεῖς βʹ ἐγράφη ἀπὸ Ἀθηνῶν· στίχοι ρϛʹ

msItem.title: Commentarius in Epistolam ad Hebraeos
msItem.incipit: Τοῖς ἐν Ιερουσαλὴμ πεπιστευκόσιν Ἰουδαίοις γράφει σφόδρα κακουμένοις
msItem.finalRubric: Πρὸς Ἑβραίους ἐγράφη ἀπὸ Ἰταλίας διὰ Τιμοθέου· στίχοι ψγʹ

msItem.title: Commentarius in Epistolam primam ad Timotheum
msItem.rubric: Ὑπόθεσις τῆς πρὸς Τιμόθεον αʹ ἐπιστολῆς
msItem.finalRubric: Πρὸς Τιμόθεον αʹ ἐγράφη ἀπὸ Λαοδικείας, ἥτις ἐστὶ μητρόπολις Φρυγίας τῆς Παρακατιανῆς· στίχοι σλʹ

msItem.title: Commentarius in Epistolam secundam ad Timotheum
msItem.rubric: Ὑπόθεσις τῆς πρὸς Τιμόθεον βʹ ἐπιστολῆς
msItem.note: At the end a stichometric note: στίχοι ροʹ.

msItem.title: Commentarius in Epistolam ad Titum
msItem.finalRubric: Πρὸς Τίτον, τῆς Κρητῶν ἐκκλησίας πρώτον ἐπίσκοπον χειροτονηθέντα· ἐγράφη ἀπὸ Νικοπόλεως τῆς Μακεδονίας· στίχοι ϟζʹ

msItem.title: Commentarius in Epistolam ad Philemonem
msItem.finalRubric: Πρὸς Φιλήμονα καὶ Ἀπφίαν, δεσπότας Ὀνησίμου, καὶ πρὸς Ἄρχιππον τῆς ἐν Κολασσαῖς ἐκκλησίας· ἐγράφη ἀπὸ Ῥώμης διὰ Ὀνησίμου οἰκέτου· στίχοι λζʹ

msItem.title: Commentarius in Epistolam primam Petri
msItem.note: At the end a stichometric note in the margin: στίχοι σλϛʹ.

msItem.title: Commentarius in Epistolam secundam Joannis
msItem.rubric: Ὑπόθεσις τῆς Ἰωάννου βʹ καθολικῆς ἐπιστολῆς

bibl.title: Catenae Graecorum patrum in Novum Testamentum

msItem.title: Commentarius in Epistolam Judae
msItem.explicit: οἱ ἀπὸ Σίμωνος καὶ τῶν ὁμοίων ἐπιτήδευον κατὰ τοὺς προειρημένους λόγους

collation.formula: Q17–2913.IVf.195 + Q30(IV + 3f.f.196–198)f.206: 3 single leaves pasted together and onto the following quaternion + Q31IVf.214 + Q32IIIf.220

bibl.title: Répertoire de réglures dans les manuscrits grecs sur parchemin: base de données
Sautel

layout.note:
On some pages the ruling pattern is closer to
Jacques-Hubert Sautel
http://viaf.org/viaf/29694003
Julien Leroy
http://viaf.org/viaf/4932629
Répertoire de réglures dans les manuscrits grecs sur parchemin: base de données Sautel Turnhout
, although this may be due to the scribe being less accurate in the execution.

handDesc.handNote: Written with brown ink in a somewhat square upright minuscule. Writing pending from ruled lines. The use of abbreviations is less conspicuous. Initials and titles in cadmium red ink. The page is dominated by the lambda and chi diagonals and a distinctive broad zeta. Some of the rubrics are written in a narrow epigraphic Auszeichungsmajuskel.

decoDesc.p: Rubricized plain initials, 1–2 lines high, passim; larger ones at the beginning of new text items, 4–5 lines high, thin and elongated with few embellishments. Headpieces and line fillers in red, black, and white, in a variety of geometrical designs, from a couple of simple red strokes with curlicues to more elaborate interlace patterns (e.g. on and ). With a few exceptions the titles are rubricized and often accompanied by red or red and black star patterns.
